title: 820 2936 dead
message:
Any pulse at least at PM_SLP_S4_L?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check again.
Do you get 3V3_S5 and 3V3_SUS?
Also check SMC_ADAPTER_EN and PM_BATLOW_L.

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.45v
PM_BATLOW_L 0v
3V3_S5 3.32v
3v3 SUS 0v
No pulse on PM_SLP_S4_L, at least none that my multi meter could pick up. Toggled SMC ON/OFF, no change.

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L 0v"
Original Apple 60/85W charger tried for sure?

title: 820 2936 dead
message: Yes, 0v PM BATLOW L measurement taken from pin 2 @ Q5040. I am using an OEM Apple 85w Magsafe 1

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
PCH will not start power on sequence untill PM_BATLOW_L goes high.
Any history available?
You may need to replace SMC, or reflow it at least.
Check S5_PWRGD signal, as PM_DSW_PWRGD and PCH_DSWVRMEN too.

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
No real history machine just stopped powering on as far as I know. The board looks like its in good shap, no LD.

S5_PWRGD 0v
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.470v
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.201v

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
Check if all 4 RTC signals have high level (page 16).
32KHz output from U2800 should be present too.

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
Check SMC_BATLOW_L.
If high, then should be PCH issue, pulling down PM_BATLOW_L.
In such case use good flux and heat PCH.
You may have luck and is only some crap under...

title: 820 2936 dead
message: SMC_BATLOW_L is 0v

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
If you are sure about original Apple 60/85W charger, then could be SMC issue.
You can try to reflow it; change it if no result...

title: 820 2936 dead
message: Im positive this is a 100% working OEM Apple charger, I bought it straight from the Apple store. I replaced the SMC, no change.

title: 820 2936 dead
message:
Try to start in SMC bypass mode, just in case.
Also try to start with battery and charger, both connected?
Not normal, but is possible that PCH blocks the SMC and this keeps SMC_BATLOW_L low.

Can you confirm with o-scope 32KHz square wave output from U2800?
Frequency meter is also good enough.

title: 820 2936 dead
message: Tried SMC Bypass, and batt/charger, no change. Unfortunately I do not have a scope or a frequency meter.
